Description: Fish as amulet: probably 'Barbus bynni' as amulet in opaque sealing-wax-red glass, the surface now wholly discoloured. The fish lies on a low plinth which is pierced through its thickness below the fish's head. The eyes are formed of some unidentified, possibly resinous, material contained within small gold discs.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: C. Andrews, 'Amulets of Ancient Egypt' (London 1994), p.93
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
